senses.de: To do something quickly and without delay
senses.ex: She was always prompt in her responses.

Tips.title: Time Sensitivity
Tips.description: Use 'prompt' to describe actions done without hesitation, showing efficiency.
Tips.example: I appreciated his prompt attention to the matter.

Tips.title: Positive Impression
Tips.description: It carries a positive connotation, often associated with good service or professionalism.
Tips.example: Her prompt reply gained her the client's trust.

senses.de: To cause someone to do something or take action
senses.ex: His curiosity prompted him to investigate further.

Tips.title: Motivation Nuance
Tips.description: 'Prompt' suggests that the action wouldn't have occurred without some external stimulus.
Tips.example: The high demand prompted the company to increase production.

Tips.title: Gentle Nudge
Tips.description: Often implies a subtle or gentle influence rather than force or direct instruction.
Tips.example: A slight hint from her coach prompted her to adjust her posture.

senses.de: A reminder or cue to help someone remember what to say or do
senses.ex: He needed a prompt to remember his lines in the play.

Tips.title: Performance Support
Tips.description: In performing arts, 'prompt' helps an actor recall forgotten lines or cues.
Tips.example: Seeing the prompt, he smoothly continued his monologue.

Tips.title: Subtle Assistance
Tips.description: Using a 'prompt' should be discreet to not distract the audience or other performers.
Tips.example: The prompt was so subtle that the audience didn't notice.

senses.de: A symbol or message in a computer program to tell the user to do something
senses.ex: The command prompt on the computer screen asked for a password.

Tips.title: User Interaction
Tips.description: Refers to signals or messages that require a response from the computer user.
Tips.example: The prompt asked me to confirm my email address.

Tips.title: Technical Context
Tips.description: Commonly used by programmers and in IT contexts to represent a command line interface.
Tips.example: Type 'exit' at the prompt to close the terminal.

senses.de: To help or encourage someone to say something
senses.ex: Her friend prompted her to share the news.

Tips.title: Conversation Aid
Tips.description: In dialogue, 'prompt' can indicate helping someone to start speaking or reply.
Tips.example: Her silence prompted him to ask if she was okay.

Tips.title: Emotional Response
Tips.description: Used to cause or elicit an emotional reaction or expression in conversation.
Tips.example: His kind words prompted her to smile.

Alert.wordDefinition:
Alert is used when there is an urgent need for attention or action to be taken. For example, a weather alert warns people of potential dangers caused by extreme weather conditions.

So, when you are alerted, it means you need to take immediate action or attention, while prompts are simply reminders or requests to do things in a timely manner.

Efficient.wordDefinition:
Efficient means doing something in a way that uses as little time, effort, or resources as possible, while still achieving a desired result.

For example, an efficient dishwasher uses less water and electricity than an inefficient one, but still cleans dishes just as well.

For example, a restaurant kitchen needs to be efficient in preparing food quickly and accurately, while a business professional needs to be prompt in replying to emails and attending meetings on time.

Immediate.wordDefinition:
Immediate means without delay or hesitation, while prompt means being on time or doing something quickly. Both words can be used in situations where something needs to be done quickly, but immediate suggests urgency and no delay, while prompt suggests doing something quickly but not necessarily right away.

For example, if someone asks for immediate help, they need it right away without any delay. If someone asks for a prompt response, they need a timely response, but it can be given within a reasonable time frame.

Punctual.wordDefinition:
Prompt means to do something quickly or without delay, while punctual means to do something at the scheduled time.

Punctuality is applicable in situations where being on time is important but there may not necessarily be a sense of urgency.

Quick.wordDefinition:
Quick refers to doing something in a short amount of time. For example, if your friend asks you how long it takes you to finish your homework, you might say it typically only takes a quick 30 minutes.

Prompt refers to doing something on time, while quick refers to doing something in a short amount of time. Prompt is applicable when time is of the essence and deadlines need to be met, while quick is applicable when the speed of completion is important, but not necessarily when a specific deadline is present.

Ready.wordDefinition:
Ready means to be prepared or fully equipped to do something. It is applicable in situations where readiness is important, such as planning for an event, anticipating a task, or being fully aware of the requirements needed to complete a task.

Prompt means quick and immediate action, while ready means preparedness and being fully equipped to do something. Both words are important and applicable in specific situations.

Responsive.wordDefinition:
Responsive means to react to something or to give a reply to a question or request. This is applicable when someone needs to answer a question or give feedback.

Prompt is used when something needs to be done quickly and responsive is used when a response or action is needed to a question or request.

Swift.wordDefinition:
Swift means to move or act with great speed, agility or efficiency. It is applicable in situations where there is a need for quick and efficient completion of a task, such as in a competitive sport, business projects or completing objectives.

Prompt is about acting quickly in response to a situation, while swift is about being fast and efficient in completing a task.

Time.wordDefinition:
Time, on the other hand, refers to a duration or period that can be measured on a clock or calendar. It's often used to talk about how long something will take, or when something is scheduled to happen.

For example, if your teacher asks you to promptly turn in your homework, they want you to do it right away. If they tell you that you have a certain amount of time to finish a task, they're giving you a deadline or duration to work within.

Prompt is used more for urgency, while time is used more for scheduling and duration.

quotes.Text: One of my favorite stories is, I got fired off 'Bionic Woman' in part because I was told that I don't know how to write women, and they promptly replaced me with a guy. What I find lovely about the story is how unaware the white dude who said that to me was when he said it.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: Laeta Kalogridis

quotes.Text: On top of the insult of destroying the geographic places we call home, the chain stores also destroyed people's place in the order of daily life, including the duties, responsibilities, obligations, and ceremonies that prompt citizens to care for each other.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: James Howard Kunstler

quotes.Text: Life is very busy now. I find that in today's cities, the public is very tired after working the whole day. When concerts start at eight o'clock, the wife pushes the husband to go to the concert, where some promptly fall asleep!
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Vladimir Horowitz

quotes.Text: There is no doubt that the recognition by economists of the importance of the role of the firm in the functioning of the economy will prompt them to investigate its activities more closely.
quotes.Title: British Economist
quotes.Name: Ronald Coase

quotes.Text: I love my last-minute lifestyle because I just sort of don't have plans, and things kind of happen. Plans make me annoyed a little bit, personally. I'm not the most prompt, on-time person.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Maxwell

quotes.Text: Work is exciting when it's challenging. It should be something that makes me afraid initially and prompts me to ask myself whether I'll be able to do it or not.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Paresh Rawal

quotes.Text: If God is slow in answering your request, or if you ask but do not promptly receive anything, do not be upset, for you are not wiser than God.
quotes.Title: Saint
quotes.Name: Isaac of Nineveh

quotes.Text: Advertising must respect the intelligence of its audience and if it does not prompt them to think, it will be instantly dismissed.
quotes.Title: Iraqi Businessman
quotes.Name: Maurice Saatchi

quotes.Text: Ambition is not in itself an evil; nor is he to be condemned whose spirit prompts him to seek fame by worthy and honourable ways.
quotes.Title: Italian Historian
quotes.Name: Francesco Guicciardini

quotes.Text: Prompting children to create imaginary worlds is hugely important.
quotes.Name: Sheila Hancock
